testcase.brief: Shutdown interface eth1 or cut off eth1 cable, check wired station
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition: Set interface eth1 to access or 802.1q mode and enable mac-learning: Interface eth1 mode bridge-access/bridge-802.1q Interface eth1 mac-learning enable Set roaming cache time: roaming cache update-interval 60 ageout 2 PC be learned by eth1 AP connect with HM _debug auth basic _debug auth info _debug auth comm Debug telnet
Test Procedure: 1. Show interface eth1 mac-learning all to check PC 2. Show auth to check connected PC 3. Show route to check if exist corresponding route of PC 4. Shutdown interface eth1 by "interface eth1 shutdown", show auth, and show interface eth1 mac-learning all to check if PC be removed 5. Show route to check if corresponding route be removed 6. Verify if PC entry be removed from HM 7. Up interface eth1 again by "no interface eth1 shutdown", check debug 8. Show interface eth1 mac-learning all, show auth and show route to check if corresponding route be added, verify if PC be reported to HM again 9. Cut off eth1 cable, show auth, and show interface eth1 mac-learning all to check if PC be removed 10. Show route to check if corresponding route be removed 11. Verify if PC entry be removed from HM 12. Connect eth1 to SWITCH again, check debug 13. Show interface eth1 mac-learning all, show auth and show route to check if corresponding route be added, verify if PC be reported to HM again

step.desc: config BR with WAN interface, nat enable, config mgt0.1
step.telnet: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server enable" -v "exec bypass-wan-hardening" -v "roaming cache update-interval 60 ageout 2"

step.desc: HTTP enable and connect to HM
step.telnet: -v "alg http enable" -v "capwap client enable" -v "capwap client server name ${pub.hm1.ip}"

step.log-match: -ps p "RUN state: Connected securely to the CAPWAP server" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.telnet: -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport mode access" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport access vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}"

step.console: -v "_debug auth basic" -v "_debug auth info" -v "_debug auth comm" -v "_debug capwap basic" -v "_debug capwap trap" -v "clear log buf"

step.setvar: echo $(echo $(echo $(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f1)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f2,3)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f4,5)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f6)) | tr "A-F" "a-f")

step.desc: set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
Show interface eth1 mac-learning all to check PC
Check if connected client be reported to HM(?)
show interface eth1 mac-learning all to check if PC be removed
Connect PC again, check client info
Check if connected client be reported to HM(?)
show interface eth1 mac-learning all to check PC
